overview: Apartheid Casablanca is an essay film made over 48 hours in reaction to a film advertising Casablanca. Nadir Bouhmouch is a radical Moroccan filmmaker whose films evoke the strength of poetic resistance and other forms of militant strategies deployed in workersâ€™ struggles in Morocco. This cinematographic collage extends and is in dialogue with the experiments of Santiago Alvarez.
title: Apartheid Casablanca
